definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
detachment left to provide covering fire
pinyin: huo3 chang3 liu2 shou3 fen1 dui4

sentences.english: Marty tried to keep his head during the fire.
sentences.chinese: 馬帝在火場中試圖保持鎮靜。

sentences.english: In the scene turns the large flame often gushes out to the window outside.
sentences.chinese: 火場內翻起的火舌不時地向窗外湧出。

sentences.english: Among those regulations are implemented to let people out during a fire.
sentences.chinese: 在這些規範中有多種手段令人們可由火場逃生。

sentences.english: It was a blessing that everyone got out of the fire safely.
sentences.chinese: 很感恩的是每一個人都平安無事地逃離火場。

sentences.english: In the fire case, you have to check every door handle before open it.
sentences.chinese: 在打開火場任何一扇門之前，都應先作檢查。

sentences.english: She took a deep breath before running into the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她深深吸了口氣衝進了火場。

sentences.english: We looked at scene of the fire in stunned silence.
sentences.chinese: 我們啞然無聲的看着火場。

sentences.english: The fire-engine arrived at the fire.
With singed hair, the panicky woman just escaped from the fire.
sentences.chinese: 這個驚懼的婦人，帶著燒焦的頭髮，剛剛逃離火場。

sentences.english: Today, a 12 year old boy died in a house fire near my neighborhood.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我家附近一名12歲的男孩葬身火場。

sentences.english: Draw on oxygen mask through the nearest agent channel to the fire spot.
sentences.chinese: 戴上氧氣面罩，從最近的緊急通道到達火場。

definition: firefighting/to extinguish a fire and save life and property/to dive (of goalkeeper in soccer)
to find/to track down/to recover (sth lost)
to relieve disaster/to help disaster victims
to escape (danger)/to rescue/to come out alive
